data.text: @TUNSW 99% of any crisis I have experienced since 2015 has been caused by my 'social' housing provider - including currently where my unit is infested with white mould, all of my belongings (however humble) ruined
@TUNSW The people dishing out this condescending judgmentalism in my experience is'social housing' providers - ineffective feedback systems and accountable to no one
@TUNSW Missing out here as I cannot get on virtually, looking forward to seeing recordings, I just hope solutions come out of this
@TUNSW Great profile building opportunity for Jane Caro who is running for parliament.

@TUNSW Morally-bankrupt economists talk about the natural rate of unemployment. The unspoken, is the tragic "natural rate of housing precarity". The housing discourse is dominated by market winners earning economic super-profits. So-called natural rates of social ills, prop up winners

Jane Caro: we live in one of the most prosperous countries in history. And yet we operate under ‘scarcity’ at all times, worried ‘we’ (those who have it) will lose it all but by driving inequality by putting $ ahead of people we may well risk it all. Everyone suffers. #nhc22

Jane Caro: “We are them: they are us”. Moving beyond resilience. Rebelling against systems that punish vulnerability, pushing for change without judging. And to do this we need to talk about class. #nhc22
